info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 11:02PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. This includes Interstate 70 between Milemarker 56 and milemarker 82. * WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding and ponding of water in the advisory area on Interstate 70 between milemarkers 56 and 82. Between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parachute, De Beque and Battlement Mesa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
